poem:
### Errata

In numbers, truth wobbles  
like shadows beneath old oaks,  
a decimal misplaced where roots  
tangle in paper seams.  
The air thickens with words  
half-spoken, a donkey's bray  
echoing Bresson's silence,  
while leaves whisper corrections  
that flutter, like wings,  
towards a clearer sky.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • Reporting a figure from the Woodland Trust, we said that neighbourhoods with the most trees had “330% less air pollution”. After publication the trust confirmed that it should have said 30% less (‘Trees are just better’, 22 February, p39). • Owing to an editing error, we credited Robert Bresson as the director of the 2022 film EO. While it is said that Bresson’s 1966 film Au hasard Balthazar inspired EO, the latter". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
